conclusion: To determine the change in magnetic flux as the coil rotates.
The initial position of the coil is such that the magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of the coil.
Magnetic flux is given by Φ = B · A · cos(θ).
Initial magnetic flux Φi = 0.1 T × 0.4 m² × 1 = 0.04 Wb.
The coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.
The angle θ between the magnetic field and the normal to the coil is now 60°.
Final magnetic flux Φf = 0.1 T × 0.4 m² × 0.5 = 0.02 Wb.
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ = 0.02 Wb - 0.04 Wb = -0.02 Wb.
Magnitude of change in magnetic flux is 0.02 Wb.
Final answer: The change in magnetic flux is 0.02 Wb.
